title: Why India needs a uniform civil code for certain functions
selftext:
Just to name a few - there are aspects of UCC that are not only intuitive but also should be universally acceptable to all religions. Ideally we should have already introduced a uniform civil code when it comes to these, and not focus on marriage laws and women's rights - which are more attractive politically. 

But these will not secure votes so political parties wrangling about UCC will never focus on these aspects for sure. 

Adoption is a case. 

[https://www.legalserviceindia.com/legal/article-9192-need-of-uniform-civil-code-for-adoption-laws-in-india-a-critical-analysis.html](https://www.legalserviceindia.com/legal/article-9192-need-of-uniform-civil-code-for-adoption-laws-in-india-a-critical-analysis.html)

[https://vakilsearch.com/blog/adoption-laws-in-india/#:\~:text=In%20India%2C%20there%20is%20no,as%20being%20a%20biological%20kid](https://vakilsearch.com/blog/adoption-laws-in-india/#:~:text=In%20India%2C%20there%20is%20no,as%20being%20a%20biological%20kid).

There is no legal way for non-Hindus to adopt a child. Instead they have to take guardianship under the 1980 guardianship act (which does not bestow upon the child either the legal umbrella or adequate security as adoption law. 

Taxation

Creation of a undivided family entity to aid everyone irrespective of religion (Vs the current HUF) 

Laws of inheritance and succession 

The current personal laws makes property dealings extremely complicated when it comes to parties belonging to different religions. A uniform law of succession will help ease inter-faith business dealings. 

​
comments:
As a Muslim im not at all against ucc but im only skeptical the intentions of bjp, it's either to legally harass Muslims or turn something into vote bank or publicity. 

UCC is a necessity but at the same time is being implemented by a party that says Hindus and Muslims are not same and they cannot live together.

Yep, the uniform civil code is there by BJP to harass the Muslims.
It's not applicable to northeast states or tribals of various states ,


They do not know the meaning of "uniform"

What is the guarantee the *uniform* civil code addresses the issues you mentioned?

Re adoption, why can't Hindu law amended to include new stuff?

Uniform Civil Code is aimed to hurt a section of the population. The intention is wrong.
